doc:
Bert Lahr https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bert_Lahr 0 Irving Lahrheim (August 13, 1895 – December 4, 1967) stage name Bert Lahr, was an American actor of stage and screen, vaudevillian and comedian. Lahr is best known for his role as the Cowardly Lion, as well as his counterpart Kansas farmworker "Zeke", in the MGM adaptation of The Wizard of Oz (1939). He was well known for his explosive humor, but also adapted well to dramatic roles and his work in burlesque, vaudeville, and on Broadway. Irving_Lahrheim ( August_13_,_1895 – December_4_,_1967 ) stage_name_Bert_Lahr , was an_American_actor of stage_and_screen_,_vaudevillian_and_comedian . Lahr is_best_known for his_role as the_Cowardly_Lion , as_well_as his_counterpart_Kansas_farmworker_"_Zeke_" , in the_MGM_adaptation of The_Wizard of Oz_(_1939_) . He was_well_known for his_explosive_humor , but_also adapted well to dramatic_roles and his_work in burlesque_,_vaudeville , and on Broadway .
